answerText: right atrium[10] This hole connecting the right atrium and left atrium should only be open in infants; after birth, it closes to form the fossa ovalis.

subject: Science
question: Question: The sinoatrial node is often called the pacemaker of the heart because it independently generates electrical impulses. For 10 points each. [10] This chamber of the heart which contains the SA node is also the site of the embryonic crista terminalis and receives incoming deoxygenated blood through the venae cavae.
